TopicTitle: What do you think about Universe Sandbox does is worh buying

Articles.Content: I actually have not heard of that one. Might get it to answer this question.

as above

really fun game!!!!!!

Great software. Allows to play with orbits, physical params, constants.

For example to add a massive companion for the Sun and watch how this effects orbits. Or a fly-through of a massive star.

Enjoyed it very much.

A little unstable. Often crashes.

At my side did not want to run offline (only with online Steam) - in contrast to KSP, Skyrim and Fallout, which are also steam, but run offline perfectly.

It is quite fun when you have those theoretical questions and need something to simulate, like "What if the moon has the same mass as the earth?" or "can a binary planets system exist within the solar system?" and such. But unless you need to simulate stuff often, I don't think you need to buy it. Even crashing galaxies together gets boring after a while, as weird as that might sound.
I have the original and the newer one. I would recommend buying them if you have an interest in simulation.
